If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.8-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3390/folder/13176670/41236541/1146027637?p=2
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sustinov@applausemail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Prerequisites:
Use a new HT account 

Steps:
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Log in to your new HT account
3. Tap FAB - Track distance
4. Create a valid route
5. Send the expense to selfDM
6. Open the created expense
7. Try editing the route

## Expected Result:
The user should be able to edit the route of a created distance expense in selfDM

## Actual Result:
Unable to edit the route after creating distance expense in selfDM if there is no active WS

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] iOS: App

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.8-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @shawnborton **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify_bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769413038845119) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Need account with a lot of reports/expenses 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Go to the Reports page > Reports > scroll down 3. Go to the Reports page > Expenses > when you have a mouse plugged in check header "Action" ## Expected Result: On step 2 skeleton rows should be aligned correctly. On step 3 the top fixed table header is not aligned correctly to the table below since the table below has shifted due to the scroll bar. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9f85a2d4-08ca-4e64-b399-4a5dd0e029ba [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Expense-No options in tax code page and It's not here page after clicking Keep this one

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.8-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/447179
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11 Pro
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
Workspace A has tax rates, categories, and tags enabled.
Workspace B does not have the taxes, categories, and tags features enabled.

1.	Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2.	Open the chat for Workspace A.
3.	Submit an expense in Workspace A with a tax rate, category, and tag (use the same amount and merchant).
4.	Submit another expense in Workspace A with all fields left empty (defaults).
5.	Open the chat for Workspace B.
6.	Submit an expense in Workspace B with the same amount and merchant as the previous entries.
7.	Open the transaction thread for the expense submitted in Workspace B.
8.	Click "Review Duplicates."
9.	Choose "Keep this one" for the first transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped since Workspace B does not have these features enabled.
10.	Return to the initial duplicate review step (where you select the transaction to keep).
11.	Choose "Keep this one" for the second transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
12.	Repeat steps 9 and 10 for the third transaction, ensuring the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped since it belongs to Workspace A.
13.	Return to the chat for Workspace A and open any transaction thread for an expense submitted there.
14.	Click "Review Duplicates."
15.	Choose "Keep this one" for the first transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
16.	Return to the initial duplicate review step.
17.	Choose "Keep this one" for the second transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped since Workspace A has these features enabled.
18.	Return to the initial duplicate review step again.
19.	Choose "Keep this one" for the third transaction and confirm that the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped, as this transaction belongs to Workspace B, which does not have these features enabled.

## Expected Result:
In steps 11 and 12, for the second and third transactions, the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
In steps 15 and 17, for the first and second transactions, the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
In step 19, for the third transaction, the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped, and the user navigates to the confirm page.

## Actual Result:
In step 11, for the second transaction, the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped. After clicking on the back arrow, the tax code page is displayed without options.
In step 12, for the third transaction, the category review step is skipped. The tax code page is displayed without options.
In steps 15 and 17, for the first and second transactions, the tax code page is displayed without options.
In step 19, for the third transaction, the "It's not here" page is displayed.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d946ce3b-ce84-47e5-872c-1f7680e2f93f

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @lschurr 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1769043449925419)
 
## Action Performed:
## Description:
In New Expensify, the Billable toggle is not shown at the expense (line-item) level, even though:
Track billable expenses is enabled on the policy
Expenses are defaulted to non-billable
Users should still be able to manually mark individual expenses as billable
This behavior differs from Expensify Classic, where users can always change the billable status at the line level when billable tracking is enabled.

## Expected Result:
At the expense level, users should see a Billable toggle / selector.
Even if expenses default to non-billable, users should be able to:
Manually mark specific line items as billable
Override the default when appropriate
This matches Classic behavior.
## Actual Result:
No billable option appears at the expense level in New Expensify.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshots for the issue is in [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1769043449925419)

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3391/folder/13176923/41237529/1146029350
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Search

## Action Performed:
Prerequisites: 
- Account has at least one workspace.
- Delayed submissions and approvals enabled.
- No expenses exist before

1. Open the Expensify app.
2. Open any workspace chat.
3. Create a manual expense.
4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses"
5. Tap on "Submit" on preview of the just created expense.
6. Tap on "Approve"
7. Note that empty state screen is shown for a few seconds after this action.
8. Mark the expense as paid.
9. Note that empty state screen appears again for a few seconds.

## Expected Result:
After approving or paying an expense while on "Expenses" section on "Reports", preview of the expense should remain visible and status should change.

## Actual Result:
After approving or paying an expense while on "Expenses" section on "Reports", empty state screen appears for a few seconds before expenses list becomes visible again.

## Workaround:
Unknown

labels.description: KSv2

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @mountiny 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name):

## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

This can be experienced in various conditions:
1. Use an account that already has some good amount of data
2. Go to Reports tab
3. Go to Workspaces

## Expected Result:
Describe what you think should've happened

The icons and avatars should render immediately, but they take longer to show.

On poor connection this can also be seen.

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

Sometimes they can be missing (take longer to show), especially when going between the bottom tabs, the avatars in the LHN in inbox or icons in the workspaces tab, or icons elsewhere, it does not seem to be specific to just some part of the app.

This leads to poor UX

It looks like the lazyloading is being triggered when it should not be, we can see icons that been already loaded missing and rendering with delay. cc @OlimpiaZurek @mollfpr 

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

## Platforms:

- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome

- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

3. Create two empty reports.
4. Go to workspace chat B.
5. Create an empty report.
6. Open FAB -> Create expense -> Per diem.
7. Select Workspace A.
8. Select any data and proceed to confirm page.
9. On confirm page, click Report field.
10. Select report from Workspace B.

## Actual Result:
Report from the other workspace doesn't appear in the report field on the confirmation page

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.8-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79668 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** MacBook air 15.7.3 Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Create a workspace 3. Navigate to Company cards 4. Add a commercial card feed (American express, for example) 5. Change the app language and open the Company card page again - the feed name is translated (the "cards" word) 6. Change the language back to English, add a direct card feed (other - Regions bank) 7. Repeat step 5 ## Expected Result: Company card direct feed name is translated ## Actual Result: Direct company card feed name is not translated (the "card" word like in commercial feeds) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/47eef8f8-3799-4444-8ae8-c252701a18d1 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Per diem-Destination field on confirm page is blank when at least two workspaces have per diem

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.8-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79939 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjiondjosjsojos11@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Create two workspaces - A and B. - Import per diem rates to both workspaces (can use the same per diem rates). 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Open FAB > Create expense > Per diem. 3. Select Workspace A. 4. Select any data and proceed to confirm page. ## Expected Result: On confirm page, Destination field should be populated with the selected destination. ## Actual Result: On confirm page, Destination field is blank. This issue only happens when there are at least two workspaces with per diem rates. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/89f882d0-94d4-473b-9656-568a68f9c86d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
